concept.title: Maps and relationships
concept.shortdesc: Maps are the way DITA helps you collect topics for publication, either as a help set, information center, or PDF.

conbody.p: You can use maps to determine which topics get processed into the output, how they get processed, and how they will be navigated on output. You can apply different maps across the same topics for different purposes, for example to produce an audience-specific organization, or a print-oriented versus online-oriented sequence.
Maps are used for building, printing, navigating, and linking topics. They are covered in more detail in their own section.
